revised_title: Pressure Broadening Studies on Vibration-Rotation Bands: Determining Line Widths
tldr: This article presents a method for determining the true widths of lines in vibration-rotation bands and studying the effect of added gases on line widths in the fundamental vibration bands of deuterium chloride and carbon monoxide. The authors investigate the pressure broadening of rotation lines in vibration-rotation bands and compare the behavior of lines with different properties. They provide a theoretical and experimental procedure to measure the relative widths of a given line for different added gases, allowing for the calculation of effective collision diameters.
